Life's a dull dusty desert, waste and drear,</br>With now and then an oasis between,</br>Where palm-trees rise, and fountains gushing clear</br>Burst neath the shelter of that leafy screen;</br>Haste not your parting steps, when such appear,</br>Repose, ye weary travellers, on the green.</br>Horace and Milton, Dante, Burns and Schiller,</br>Dined at a tavern — then they had "the siller."

And ne'er did poet, epical or tragical,</br>At Florence, London, Weimar, Rome, Maybole,</br>See time's dark lanthern glow with hues more magical</br>Than I have witnessed in the Coffin-hole.</br>Praise of antiquity a bam and fudge I call,</br>Ne'er past the present let my wishes roll;</br>A fig for all comparing, croaking grumblers,</br>Hear me, dear dimpling Billy, bring the tumblers.

Let blank verse hero, or Spenserian rhymer,</br>Treat Donna Musa with chateau-margout,</br>Chateau-la-filte, Johannisberg, Hocheimer,</br>In tall outlandish glasses, green and blue,</br>Thanks to my stars, myself, a doggrel-chimer,</br>Have nothing with such costly tastes to do;</br>My muse is always kindest when I court her</br>O'er whisky-punch, gin-twist, strong beer, and porter....</br>
